alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Livingston; Northern Erie; Southern Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW SLOWLY LIFTING NORTHWARD ACROSS WYOMING...ERIE...WESTERN LIVINGSTON AND SOUTHERN GENESEE COUNTIES... At 1125 PM EST, a band of heavy snow producing snowfall rates over 3 inches per hour was located over Billington Heights, or over East Aurora, moving north at 25 mph. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lackawanna, Kenmore, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Lancaster, Hamburg, Geneseo, East Aurora, Williamsville, Darien Lakes State Park, Letchworth State Park, Grand Island, Evans and Elma. This includes the following highways... Interstate 390 near exit 7. Interstate 90 between exits 57A and 49. The snow will accumulate at a rate of 3 inches or more per hour in this area of heavy snow. Visibility will be reduced to less than one quarter mile in this area of heavy snow. Travel will become very difficult if not impossible as this area of heavy snow impacts the area the next couple hours as all roads will quickly be covered with several inches of snow. A Winter Storm Warning remains in effect for the area. Please monitor local media outlets and the National Weather Service for further statements.
